title: "Standard" firefox says NO cross site tracking, NOT?
content:
i stumbled on site actblue is sharing with 2 cross site cookies with websites i never allowed. i never look at the details because mac firefox "Standard" text implies never can have cross site tracking. (i find no exceptions in my profile and i would have never knowingly allowed any cross site tracking.) how can i quickly see which sites in my firefox currently allow cross site tracking?

Standard Balanced for protection and performance. Pages will load normally. Firefox blocks the following: Social media trackers Cross-site cookies in all windows Tracking content in Private Windows Cryptominers Fingerprinters Includes Total Cookie Protection, our most powerful privacy feature ever Total Cookie Protection contains cookies to the site you’re on, so trackers can’t use them to follow you between sites.

thank you!

title: My account doesnt synchronize to the web browser
content:
Hi, I recently formatted my pc, and as I usually do, when I download the browser I enter my email which has all my bookmarks and favorites, the problem is that it does not synchronize the data I had with my account.

I have used about Sync, I have checked the profiles and deleted the places.sql file that is commented in other posts similar to my problem, I have checked the logs of the synchronization and it does not show any error.

I don't know what else to try, but I do know that the last time I did the same and entered my account to the browser (about 2 years ago) everything synchronized without any problem.

I hope you can give me a solution here, since Mozilla Support team does not take care of these "problems".
creator: nielaela

title: No se sincronizan los datos de mi perfil
content:
Hola, recientemente he formateado mi pc, y como usualmente hago, al descargarme el navegador introduzco mi correo electrónico el cual posee todos mis marcadores y favoritos, el problema es que no sincroniza los datos que tenía con mi cuenta.

He utilizado about Sync, he revisado los perfiles y eliminado el archivo places.sql que se comentan en otros posts similares a mi problema, he revisado los logs de la sincronización y no muestra ningún error.

No se qué más probar, pero si se que la ultima vez que hice lo mismo e ingresé mi cuenta al navegador (hace 2 años aprox) todo se sincronizo sin ningun problema.

Espero que me puedan dar una solución por aquí, ya que Mozilla Support team no se encarga de estos "problemas".

title: Repositioning of Firefox window after every start of Firefox
content:
Dear Madams and Sirs,

i hope you can help me.

As a (web ) developer (and fan of Firefox) I use Firefox every day and i restart the browser serveral times a day.

I use a Dell U3417W as an external display (widescreen, notebook display is deactivated if i use the external display) under windows 10 & 11 and i want Firefox at the right half side of the Screen (using windows + right or manuel positioning/resizing of the Firefox window).

At start of Firefox, first it will fit the right side of the screen without any offset (last saved position from xulstore.json) - only for a very short moment. Immediately after the start the window will automatically repositioned to an offset of appox. 5px from the right/button position (see attached screen). Then i have to use windows + right or mouse drag to the right border of the screen to get the right position again.

At next start of Firefox the Firefox window is at the same offset position again.

I searched the web for serveral ours to find a solution: I tried to Refresh Firefox, delete xulstore.json, i have only the standard dark theme active (FF 128.03 and earlier versions, now in win11, win10 the same), tried the fingerprint.. = false approach, nothing works.

Firefox is the only application with this behavier. Chrome, Edge i.e. does not have the kind of shifting...

Thanks in advance and greetings from Berlin

Daniel
creator: dm.moz

title: Customizing settings and preferences
content:
I have used Firefox before, and I want to confirm that what i could do in the past is now no longer possible. In the screenshot, you see in the "Home" section, you are able to pick what shows for your home page and new windows. Then you see What you can choose to happen on new tabs. I have set it to pull Google's home page. You used to be able to set the new tabs to whatever you wanted as well. However, you no longer can. Is this the way it is intended to work? If so, this should be rethought. No one wants to set their browser to open a new web page whenever they want to look something up, much less just in general to get to their home page. I understand and know that you can add the home button to the toolbar, but that creates an extra step.

Now if this was intended to be this way, where may I express my dissatisfaction with this option?

title: Recent updates causing multiple 2-step authentication issues?
content:
For the last two days, I have not been able to use Firefox to sign and properly use two key platforms for work: Booking.com and Expedia. Both now demand two-factor/step authentication at sign-up which I can live with BUT every time I click a link once signed in that they deem is sensitive (like looking at the details of a particular reservation or accessing their help messaging tools), I am asked to go through the authentication again. For every task. This means, for example, to change a room for a guest I now need to receive three different SMS codes as the platforms somehow stop recognising that I've already logged in.

I haven't changed any settings on Expedia, Booking.com or Firefox so any ideas on how to solve this please?

Thanks in advance Kevin

title: Youtube streams not auto-updating
content:
Sorry for the vague title, wasn't sure how to be more specific as it's actually two problems related to the same topic.

Since I got my new PC last week, I noticed that any streams from Youtube aren't auto-updating. By this I mean the countdown timer in the bottom left of the stream, which usually says something like "Starts in 75 minutes" but even if half a hour has passed, it will still say that message. For clarification, I'm a viewer, not the creator.

Secondly, when the stream is supposed to start, it just won't, unless I refresh the page. I doublechecked this by opening a seperate window of the same stream. Even 20 minutes after the stream has started, on the first window it still won't start (and ofcourse the big red play button has been pressed long before that).

I never had those issues with my old PC. Though it's unlikely to be a local setting with Firefox in about:config either, because I tried with other browsers like Brave and Chrome and the same issues persists there. But I'm not sure where else to go with this problem.

title: all my tabs from open session disappeared?!?!?
content:
Locking this thread, please continue here: [/questions/1456385]
all my tabs from open session disappeared?!?!?

and no way to restore it; the option disappeared and I never erased it or close any of the tabs manually and it was on sync. Where did they all go ? I can see now the history from my laptop mixed with my mobile under the history tab but the session disappeared?!?!

Firefox use to be EXCEPTIONAL and 2 years ago it star5ed to go downward; please convince me to stay loyal and not switch to brave or opera; this is becoming worst every months.

I did everything I found with ChatGpt and nothing works:(## Recovering Lost Tabs in Firefox Android

I understand that all your open tabs in Firefox Android have disappeared, even though they are synced. Don't worry, there are ways to restore them and reopen that session on your mobile device.

    • Here are the steps to recover your lost tabs:**
    • 1. Check Recently Closed Tabs:**
  • Open Firefox on your Android device.
  • Tap the three dots menu in the top right corner.
  • Select "History" from the menu.
  • Choose "Recently Closed Tabs" from the History list.
  • This will display a list of recently closed tabs. If you see the session you're looking for, tap on it to restore all the tabs.
    • 2. Use the "Restore Previous Session" Feature:**
  • If the "Recently Closed Tabs" option doesn't work, try the "Restore Previous Session" feature.
  • Open Firefox on your Android device.
  • Tap and hold the "Home" button.
  • A pop-up menu will appear. Select "Restore Previous Session".
  • This will restore the last browsing session you had open, including all the tabs.
    • 3. Check Your Synced Devices:**
  • If the above methods don't work, check if your lost tabs are open on another synced device.
  • Open Firefox on your computer or another mobile device where you are logged in with the same Firefox account.
  • Look for the lost tabs in the "History" or "Recently Closed Tabs" section.
  • If you find them, you can open them on your Android device by syncing your browsing history.
    • 4. Contact Firefox Support:**
  • If none of the above methods work, you can contact Firefox support for further assistance.
  • You can reach them through their website: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/products/firefox/fix-problems/
  • Explain your situation and they will try to help you recover your lost tabs.
    • Additional Tips:**
  • To prevent this from happening again, consider enabling the "Open Tabs in Background" setting in Firefox. This will keep your tabs open even if you close the app.
  • You can also set Firefox to automatically restore your previous session when you open the app.
    • I hope this helps you recover your lost tabs and reopen your session on your mobile device.**); is there a way im missing ?

Only thing that happened is that I restared my phone earlier?!
creator: diego22
